> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17206?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [924b433...8a15074](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17206?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
@TomAugspurger @gfyoung, we're passing. Did you want me to make a What's New entry?

Currently, this PR is ready, except for @jreback's outstanding review: https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17206#pullrequestreview-55496287. I'm happy to "add a generalized compression test", but I need some additional guidance. Refer to the line-by-line discussion under the review.

Moving that out of the inline comment that was squashed:

> @jreback, Just to make sure we're on the same page. All path types would be:
> 
> - local paths via strings
> - local paths via fspath defining objects
> - URLs
> All compression types would be None, xz, bz2, zip, and gzip. But in all cases, we'd be inferring > compression?

@dhimmel it'll be similar to https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/330b8c1c195174f729a1d2ee6f916ebd1579217e/pandas/tests/io/test_common.py#L130

You can parametrize over readers, extensions, and path types (string, pathlib, py.path, and `CustomFSPath`).

What all readers should this support?

quite a lot of these tests already exists

just the case for the oathlib type objects i think are a bit lite

however the fspath tests are centralized 
i would move these to the io readers themselves (where the reg path compression tests are)

Okay I moved the tests to `tests/io/test_common.py`. The new test only tests `_infer_compression` rather than testing entire file reading, so it's lighter weight. 

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/0f925c15d6d8a3c2248139f07fef3bb61385fecd/pandas/tests/io/test_common.py#L91-L102

> You can parametrize over ... path types (string, pathlib, py.path, and CustomFSPath).

@TomAugspurger see what I did in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/17206/commits/0f925c15d6d8a3c2248139f07fef3bb61385fecd to parametrize over path types. It requires creating a module level variable `path_types`... I couldn't identify a more elegant way.

> You could potentially add that to conftest.py, but I think it's fine as is.

Probably best for me to avoid touching `pandas/conftest.py`. Let's save that for someone who knows the the testing architecture a bit better (:

> You could potentially add that to conftest.py, but I think it's fine as is.

I agree.  There is no need to do this.  Ping on green!
@gfyoung pls don't merge things that I have an outstanding review on.

> pls post a new PR with this

Okay the actual scope of this PR is `read` methods that infer compression using `pandas.io.common._infer_compression`. Would that be appropriate to state in the What's New? 

Ideally, all read methods would use the common functions in `io.common`, but that's not the case (see https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/15008). I don't really have time right now to go through all these read methods and see which are affected. I am interesting in consolidating the `read_*` code, but would prefer to wait till `pandas2`... since ensuring Python 2 support makes this work quite tedious.

Given these considerations, this PR's scope is to add path-like object support to `_infer_compression`. @jreback let me know how to update the What's New.
